skill.name: writing-plans
skill.description: Use when you have a spec or requirements for a multi-step task, before touching code
skill.summary: Use when you have a spec or requirements for a multi-step task, before touching code
skill.author: obra

security_audit.summary: SKILL.md is a pure documentation file containing markdown guidance for writing implementation plans. All 19 static findings are false positives: the analyzer mistook markdown code blocks showing example commands for actual shell execution, and plain text descriptions for cryptographic algorithms. No executable code, scripts, or command execution capability exists.

content.value_statement: Multi-step tasks lack clear direction. This skill creates detailed implementation plans with bite-sized tasks, exact file paths, test-first examples, and commit-ready steps for any developer.
actual_capabilities: Creates implementation plans with bite-sized tasks (2-5 minutes each)
Documents exact file paths and line ranges for modifications
Includes test-first code examples with pytest commands
Provides commit-ready git commands with conventional messages
Follows DRY, YAGNI, and frequent commit principles
limitations: Requires a spec or requirements document as input
Should be run in a dedicated worktree created by brainstorming skill
Does not execute plans or write actual code

use_cases.title: Plan complex features
use_cases.description: Break down complex features into actionable tasks with exact file paths and test examples

use_cases.title: Onboard new developers
use_cases.description: Provide clear implementation guidance for team members unfamiliar with the codebase

use_cases.title: Structure review feedback
use_cases.description: Create task-based plans that make large changes manageable and reviewable

prompt_templates.title: Simple feature request
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an implementation plan for [feature name] based on these requirements: [paste requirements]

prompt_templates.title: Refactoring task
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a plan to refactor [component] to improve [specific aspect]. Focus on test coverage.

prompt_templates.title: API integration
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a plan to integrate [API/service] including error handling, tests, and documentation.

prompt_templates.title: Complex multi-file change
prompt_templates.prompt: Plan implementation of [feature] that touches [list files]. Include all dependent changes.

output_examples.input: Create a plan to add user authentication with JWT tokens
output: Includes 8 bite-sized tasks with test-first examples
Each task has exact file paths, pytest commands, and git commit steps

output_examples.input: Plan a database migration for adding indexes
output: Migration plan with rollback steps included
Tasks for schema changes, data migration, and tests
Each step specifies exact migration file paths

output_examples.input: Plan adding rate limiting to the API
output: Implementation plan with 6 tasks covering configuration, middleware, and tests
Includes Redis configuration and error handling
Final task adds documentation and integration tests

best_practices: Run this skill in a dedicated worktree for isolated planning
Provide complete requirements or specs for accurate task breakdown
Review generated plans before execution to verify file paths
anti_patterns: Using without clear requirements leads to incomplete plans
Skipping the plan and jumping directly to implementation
Modifying plan files after execution begins (creates drift)

faq.question: What input does this skill need?
faq.answer: This skill requires a spec or requirements document describing the feature to implement.

faq.question: How detailed are the tasks?
faq.answer: Tasks are 2-5 minute micro-steps with code examples and exact commands.

faq.question: Can I modify the plan?
faq.answer: Yes, plans are markdown files. Edit before execution to match your workflow.

faq.question: Does this execute the plan?
faq.answer: No, this skill only creates plans. Use executing-plans skill for execution.

faq.question: Where are plans saved?
faq.answer: Plans are saved to docs/plans/ with date and feature name in the filename.

faq.question: What workflow works best?
faq.answer: Use brainstorming first, then writing-plans, then executing-plans in sequence.
